result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Van Hoosen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

*Pay costs 
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge/DNA Surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Provide DNA Sample if not already done

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J. Van Hoosen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley J. Van Hoosen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:37 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen indicates that the victim has had and continues to have contact with the defendant as she had filed a Family Safety Plan.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
*Pay $200 fine plus costs which would include the domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Provide a DNA sample if not done so already

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley J. Van Hoosen
Current: 3517 Bush Street #3, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: 3517 Bush Street #3, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
